title: Mobile-Based Social and Occupational Manual Reading Comprehension Assessment Program for Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary education-level reading comprehension, professional work experience, and foundational understanding of social structures (organizational culture, institutional environments)
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-based limited-technology environments, emphasizing workplace integration for professionals and enhancing organizational decision-making capabilities through socio-occupational manual analysis.

learning_goals: Within 4 weeks, extract core arguments from professional social/vocational texts (medical/legal/technical) with 80% accuracy according to rubric criteria, and develop the ability to analyze intertextual relationships.

Using 10 provided assessment rubrics, learners autonomously establish reading comprehension strategies and apply them to professional work contexts (e.g., inter-institutional collaboration, policy analysis).

During a 2-week project period, learners write a critical analysis report based on ≥3 datasets collected from real-world scenarios (e.g., customer requirement analysis, process improvement cases), following a given template with 5 mandatory sections (problem definition, data analysis, alternative solutions, implementation plan, expected outcomes), and propose practical solutions considering sociopolitical contexts.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
